explanation: Agent A is correct. Rule 14.3 forbids controlling expressions that are invariant (i.e. always true or always false) except for the listed exceptions. In the provided code the controlling expression if (MHD_NO != MHD_is_feature_supported(MHD_FEATURE_POLL)) is effectively invariant for a given build: the function MHD_is_feature_supported, as shown, returns either MHD_YES or MHD_NO based solely on preprocessor configuration and other compile-time constants. That means, for any particular build configuration, the condition will always evaluate the same way at run time (true or false) and therefore constitutes an invariant controlling expression and so violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. The rule exceptions (infinite loops or the special do-while constant-false case) do not apply here. If runtime variability is intended, the function would need to perform a real runtime probe; otherwise the correct MISRA-compliant approach is to make the choice at compile time (e.g. use #ifdef HAVE_POLL to conditionally compile the printf) or to document and justify a formal deviation from the rule.
